official_title: A bill to exempt certain blood fractions from the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act for five years, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Excludes blood fractions used in immunoaugmentative therapy by the Immunology Researching Center, Limited, of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island, Bahamas, from the definition of drug under the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act for a period of five years. Expresses the sense of Congress that the Federal Government and the medical profession should cooperate with Dr. Lawrence P. Burton in his cancer research and therapy.

titles.title: A bill to exempt certain blood fractions from the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act for five years, and for other purposes.
